description: The West Texas measles outbreak continues to grow, now possibly spreading into the central part of the state and neighboring New Mexico, health officials said Friday.
title: Thousands of Texans possibly exposed to measles as outbreak swells to 146 cases

description: The CDC put out a statement on the measles outbreak and suggested that vitamin A could be used for supportive care. Is vitamin A effective for measles?
title: What to know about vitamin A and the measles

description: WASHINGTON — At least seven top prosecutors inside the U.S.
title: Jan. 6 prosecutors demoted by Trump-appointed U.S. attorney in Washington

description: The president's upcoming executive order making English the official U.S. language reignites a debate over what changes could take place in the Spanish-speaking U.S. territory, especially if Puerto Rico becomes a state.
title: Puerto Ricans worry over new Trump order designating English as U.S. official language

description: Philadelphia 76ers center Joel Embiid will miss the remainder of the NBA regular season with a left knee injury, the team announced Friday.
title: 76ers star Joel Embiid ruled out for season with knee injury

description: President Donald Trump, ready to wrap up his Oval Office meeting Friday with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, asked for one last question from the reporters gathered in the room.
title: Vance leans hard into Trump's foreign policy — and sparks an extraordinary Oval Office skirmish

description: Caleb Wilson, a 20-year-old junior at Southern University and A&M College, died Thursday after attending an off-campus event in Baton Rouge, Louisiana.
title: Louisiana college student dies in off-campus event, university halts fraternity initiation activities

description: When the Los Angeles wildfires swept through Southern California in January, Barbara Shay lost much more than the building housing the cafe she owned.
title: In wake of L.A. wildfires, a diverse small business community looks to rebuild

description: A 76-year-old man who went into hiding following a 1982 bombing and allegedly assumed the identity of his dead college classmate was arrested this month at his home in New Mexico after a standoff with law enforcement.
title: Fugitive in 1982 bombing evaded capture by assuming dead classmate's identity, officials say

description: The U.S. is in the midst of its first “high severity” flu season in seven years. Flu activity has slowed in recent weeks, but experts warn that the season isn’t over yet.
title: Why is the flu so bad this year?

description: The creators of a controversial AI-generated video shared by President Donald Trump on social media say they never meant to become a “propaganda machine,” and that their video, which depicts an outlandish vision of Gaza featuring bearded dancers in bikinis and a giant golden Trump statue, was created as satire.
title: 'Trump Gaza' AI video creators say they don't want to be the president's 'propaganda machine'

description: An Illinois jury has convicted Josephy Czuba of fatally stabbing 6-year-old Wadee Alfayoumi in an attack prosecutors say was motivated by the Israel-Hamas war.
title: Illinois man guilty in fatal stabbing of 6-year-old Palestinian-American boy

description: The U.S.
title: U.S. Mint takes Jan. 6 coin honoring officers who protected the Capitol off its website

description: Concerns among migrant advocates arise as officials in Costa Rica and Panama are confiscating migrants’ passports and cellphones and denying them access to legal services.
title: Panama and Costa Rica can't turn into 'black hole' for migrants, Human Rights Watch says

description: An Illinois man was found guilty Friday? in the fatal stabbing of a Palestinian American boy and the wounding of his mother.
title: Illinois man convicted of murder and hate crimes in stabbing of 6-year-old Palestinian American boy

description: The State Department this week terminated a U.S. Agency for International Development initiative that has invested hundreds of millions of dollars to help restore Ukraine's energy grid from attacks by the Russian military.
title: State Department terminates U.S. support of Ukraine energy grid restoration

description: The Los Angeles Rams and Matthew Stafford have agreed to a restructured contract to ensure the quarterback remains with the franchise for the 2025 NFL season, according to multiple reports.
title: Rams QB Matthew Stafford set to return to team next season

description: President Trump and Vice President JD Vance hold a tense meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy as they negotiate a possible peace deal.
title: Special Report: Trump and Zelenskyy meet in tense Oval Oval exchange

description: President Trump, Ukrainian President Zelenskyy and Vice President Vance had a tense exchange about the ongoing war with Russia. Vance asked Zelenskyy if he has ever said "thank you" for U.S. aid and Trump clashed with him over what has been provided.
title: Trump tells Zelenskyy he's 'gambling with World War III' in tense exchange

description: President Trump, Ukrainian President Zelenskyy and Vice President Vance had a tense exchange about the ongoing war with Russia. Vance asked Zelenskyy if he has ever said "thank you" for U.S. aid and Trump clashed with him over what has been provided.
title: Trump tells Zelenskyy he's 'gambling with World War III' in tense exchange

description: President Donald Trump says the United States and Ukraine are poised to sign an agreement on rare earth minerals “and other things” — or at least they were before a heated moment between him, Vice President JD Vance, and Ukrainian Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in the Oval Office on Friday.
title: What to know about Ukraine's mineral wealth

description: Celebrity tributes are pouring in for Gene Hackman after the revered 95-year-old actor and his wife Betsy Arakawa were found dead in their Santa Fe, New Mexico, home.
title: Celebrity tributes pour in for Gene Hackman: 'Powerful, subtle, brilliant'

description: Faulty use of facial recognition technology led to the unjust arrest of a Detroit woman, she said in a federal lawsuit, claiming police failed to ask basic questions that could've cleared her on the spot.
title: Detroit woman suing police, claiming faulty facial recognition technology led to unjust arrest

description: Whether it’s a dozen eggs or a new car, Americans are having a hard time adjusting to current prices.
title: Americans are suffering from 'sticker shock' — here's how to adjust

description: Simu Liu co-stars in a new survivalist escape movie about deep-sea divers battling the elements to rescue their crewmate.
title: Simu Liu says 'The Last Breath' saturation diving training demanded intensity and camaraderie

description: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau’s Trump-appointed leadership plans to fire nearly all its 1,700 employees while “winding down” the agency, according to testimony from employees.
title: Trump administration, Musk's DOGE plan to fire nearly all CFPB staff and wind down agency, employees say

description: A South Carolina man was shot and killed by a shotgun booby trap allegedly set up by one of his family members, police said on Tuesday.
title: South Carolina man killed by family member's shotgun booby trap, police say

description: Trump is expected to sign an executive order aimed at making English the official language of the U.S., according to a White House official.
title: Trump to sign an executive order making English the official U.S. language

description: The investigation into the mysterious deaths of actor Gene Hackman and his wife, Betsy Arakawa, at their home in Santa Fe, New Mexico, entered its third day Friday with more looming questions than answers.
title: Investigators pursue clues in deaths of Gene Hackman and wife Betsy Arakawa

description: Watch live coverage as President Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy hold a joint press conference at the White House.
title: Trump and Zelenskyy hold press conference

description: Doug Lane speaks out about the loss of  his wife and son in the plane crash over the Potomac River in D.C.
title: Figure skater’s dad describes agony of losing wife and son in D.C. plane crash

description: As President Donald Trump is set to meet with Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelenskyy to broker a deal to end the war overseas and give the United States access to their rare earth minerals, Trump backpedals on his combative comments, including calling Zelenskyy a “dictator.” NBC’s Garrett Haake reports for TODAY.
title: Trump backpedals Zelenskyy ‘dictator’ comment ahead of meeting

description: Santa Fe County Sheriff Adam Mendoza and Santa Fe’s fire chief Brian Moya join TODAY to share their insights into the death of actor Gene Hackman and his wife, Betsy Arakawa, who were discovered deceased on Wednesday. “Just based on their body and other evidence on the body, it appears several days and possibly up to a couple weeks,” Sheriff Mendoza shares about the timeline.
title: Investigators speak out on deaths of Gene Hackman, Betsy Arakawa

description: Trump to host Zelenskyy; foreign aid freeze heads to the Supreme Court
title: Trump to host Zelenskyy; foreign aid freeze heads to the Supreme Court

description: Thousands of federal workers have been fired in the last month. They're victims of efforts by Donald Trump and his senior adviser, Elon Musk, to downsize the government.
title: 'Devastated.' 'Cruel.' 'Surreal.' Federal workers share the toll of losing their identity

description: House Democratic leaders are getting directly involved in one of the legal battles against the Trump administration, filing an amicus brief in support of a lawsuit seeking to block the dismantling of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.
title: House Democrats join legal fight against Trump's efforts to dismantle consumer protection agency

description: The NHL scored big by going global to fight midseason doldrums, leaving North America's other major pro sports leagues to ponder what they could do to re-energize their dreary all-star breaks.
title: 4 Nations lit the lamp for NHL, but could it work in the NBA or MLB?

description: WASHINGTON — Republicans are considering a far-reaching change to the budget process that would obscure the deficit impact of extending President Donald Trump’s multitrillion-dollar tax cuts in order to avoid paying for them.
title: Republicans consider major budget change to obscure deficit impact of extending Trump's tax cuts

description: A U.S. sailor plotted to attack Naval Station Great Lakes with bombs and guns and also targeted tourist locations in Chicago including the Magnificent Mile and the famous Bean statue in Millennium Park.
title: Former Navy sailor admits plotting terror attack against Naval Station Great Lakes

description: At least 20 dead birds found on a small beach in East Patchogue, New York, are now being tested for avian flu, sparking concerns in the community. WNBC’s Pei-Sze Cheng reports.
title: Dead birds found on New York beach believed to have died from avian flu

description: A Long Island beachside community in Suffolk County is worried about dozens of dead birds that have washed up on the shore and been found in backyards, especially because officials believe the birds died from avian flu.
title: Dozens of dead birds found on Long Island beach believed to have died from avian flu

description: PHOENIX — Prior damage to the landing gear on a private jet owned by Mötley Crüe singer Vince Neil could have contributed to a fatal crash earlier this month, according to a preliminary report released Thursday by the National Transportation Safety Board.
title: Private plane crash that killed a pilot could be tied to known landing gear issue, NTSB report says

description: Matthew Huttle, who was pardoned by President Trump for his role in the Jan. 6 attack, was fatally shot by a sheriff’s deputy in Indiana during a traffic stop. Body camera video shows Huttle getting into the vehicle and threatening to shoot himself before the deputy opened fire.
title: Body cam video shows fatal traffic stop of man pardoned for Jan. 6 crime

description: An Indiana man who stormed the Capitol on Jan. 6 and had recently been pardoned by President Donald Trump told authorities that he couldn't afford to be in legal trouble just before he was fatally shot by a sheriff’s deputy during a traffic stop last month, body camera video released Thursday shows.
title: Man pardoned for Jan. 6 crime feared returning to jail before he was killed in traffic stop by deputy

description: Legendary Hollywood actor Gene Hackman and his wife, Betsy Arakawa, were found dead in their Santa Fe, New Mexico, home Wednesday, prompting investigating officials to call their deaths "suspicious."
title: What we know about the death of Gene Hackman and his wife, Betsy Arakawa

description: U.S. District Judge John Bates called the Department of Government Efficiency's work "opaque" as he ordered an official to shed more light on its structure and activity.
title: Judge orders DOGE employee to testify in lawsuit against the Trump administration

description: A proposal approved by the state's Board of Education exposed divisions over how far should states go to enforce President Donald Trump's immigration policies.
title: Oklahoma Republicans clash over requiring schoolchildren to prove citizenship status

description: The bill — the first legislative action in the country to remove nondiscrimination protections based on gender identity — heads to Republican Gov. Kim Reynolds.
title: Iowa gives final approval to a bill to remove gender identity protections despite massive protests

description: Legendary actor Gene Hackman, his wife Betsy Arakawa, and their dog were found dead at their Santa Fe home Wednesday. Authorities say they had been dead for “quite a while” before their bodies were found in separate rooms of their house, and called their deaths “suspicious.” NBC News' Dana Griffin reports from New Mexico.
title: Gene Hackman, wife and dog found dead in Santa Fe

description: President Trump met with British Prime Minister Keir Starmer at the White House. In an interview with NBC News’ Lester Holt, Starmer praised President Trump for kick starting peace talks, while saying any deal must have security guarantees to assure Russia’s President Putin will not invade again.
title: Trump meets British Prime Minister as peace talks over Ukraine kick off

description: An effort to encourage U.S. consumers to participate in a day of protest by not spending money Friday has picked up momentum online, with thousands of people across social media saying they plan to take part in the “economic blackout.”
title: Some people online are planning an ‘economic blackout’ Friday. What does that mean?
